question: 1.You are going to another country to study. You would like to do a part-time job while you are studying, so you want to ask a friend who lives there for some help. Write a letter to this friend.In your letter: •	Give details of your study plans•	Explain why you want to get a part-time job•	Suggest how your friend could help you find a job
text: I hope this letter finds you in radiant health and the best of spirits. I am writing you this letter pertinent that in next month I will come to Canada for my further master's study. I have taken admission to a British university which is located in British Colombia .

As per our last ,talk you just transfer your home, Alberta, to British Colombia so please give me one fever regarding searching out the rented apartment for me in this city and I also want to do a job causing I can easily manage my university fees as well as other expenses like home rent ,food ,transportation and many more. You know extremely well about my situation in India as my father can not afford all my expenses.

With this , letter I attached my curriculum vitae with all my experience till now as  hotel management and I have also done one year course  six months ago which is  flawlessly prominent for searching for amiable employment in Canada. If you share a pdf file with any company ,give me your email on my whatsup number so that I will send you as soon as possible because it would be influx flexible for you.

error_list.error_des: The noun phrase letter seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The word Trusha is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts.
